overview_of_class: This course investigates the history of gender and sexuality in England from 1500 to 1800. Public scandals served as moments of stress, revealing the cultural faultlines in the changing world of early modern England. Themes of the course include gender conformity, sexual reputation, and the policing of desire. Topics include cross-dressing, women on stage, molly houses, courtesans, libertines, the amorous relationship of King James and the duke of Buckingham, and the trial and execution of Anne Boleyn.
name: Sex after Shakespeare
title: WCAS HISTORY 361-0-1 Sex after Shakespeare
